Risk_of_Bias: Moderate - randomized but unclear allocation concealment method
Diagnostic_Criteria: Two or more well-defined round hypodense lesions with ring enhancement on CT, at least one in vesicular stage, positive ELISA for cysticercosis antibodies
Age_Mean_SD: Group A: 28 ± 2 years, Group B: 30 ± 2 years
Imaging_Schedule: 3 months after treatment, then every 6 months
Complete_Resolution_Percentage: At 5 years - Group A: 56.75%, Group B: 73%
Partial_Resolution_Percentage: At 5 years - Group A: 9.45%, Group B: 6.66%
Seizure_Reduction_Percentage: Control group had better seizure outcomes; treatment group had higher recurrence (p=0.05)
Other_AE: Treatment group: 2 deaths from intractable seizures and encephalopathy, increased hospital readmissions, higher calcification rate (33.78% vs 22.66%)
Comments: Albendazole treatment showed no benefit over antiepileptic drugs alone, and was associated with increased adverse events and higher calcification rates. Control group showed better lesion resolution.
